text:
<@UUS6GL8BH>
1. Regarding tmux + kak, its better to just install the kitty terminal... Heck, its the most awesome terminal I've ever used. Then you won't need tmux at all.
2. The momentum in kak, (as awesome as the software itself is) is kinda... slow or dead... I think it's because there're waaaay less people working on kak and kak-lsp. The fixes come in 2-4 years... which means we've to probably implement the stuff we want ourselves.
3. Listing the stuff - 1. A better implementation for the lsp-hover in kak-lsp and 2. Figuring if the problem in unicode auto-complete lies within kakoune or kak-lsp, and then fixing it.

elements.text: Regarding tmux + kak, its better to just install the kitty terminal... Heck, its the most awesome terminal I've ever used. Then you won't need tmux at all.

The momentum in kak, (as awesome as the software itself is) is kinda... slow or dead... I think it's because there're waaaay less people working on kak and kak-lsp. The fixes come in 2-4 years... which means we've to probably implement the stuff we want ourselves.
Listing the stuff - 1. A better implementation for the lsp-hover in kak-lsp and 2. Figuring if the problem in unicode auto-complete lies within kakoune or kak-lsp, and then fixing it.

text: Supports native splitting, without any lag

elements.text: Supports native splitting, without any lag

text: Tmux has input lag, which was off-putting

text: So what's your set up now? kakoune + kitty?
